Lunenburg Celebrates

June 7 – 11, 2017

It’s Lunenburg’s birthday,
and we’re going to celebrate in style!

Preparations are underway for our 3rd annual Be A Tourist in Your Town weekend! Once again various groups and organizations are hosting events to help mark the Town’s 264th birthday. The actual birthday is Wednesday, June 7 but most activities will take place the following weekend.

The Be a Tourist concept was designed to help encourage residents and visitors alike to take some time to explore all that our beautiful town has to offer and enjoy the assortment of activities that take place in our own backyard.

Connect with us on #lunenburgcelebrates

Town of Lunenburg and Rhumb Line Bike Shop

Bike Rodeo

We will inspect your bikes to ensure they are in proper working order, teach safe cycling guidelines and test your skills in our obstacle course. Fun for all ages! Helmets are required.

More Info

Time: June 7. 2:45pm
Place: Community Centre Parking Lot

Lunenburg Folk Harbour Society

Open House

Come learn about all the work the society does to conserve, preserve and promote the natural and cultural history of Lunenburg.

More Info

Time: June 7, 8, 9. 9:00am-5:00pm
Place: 125 Montague Street

Bluenose II

Deck Tours and Film

Open House at the Company Store will allow you to meet the 2017 Crew before they depart Lunenburg on June 12th to participate in Sail Boston & the Rendez-Vous 2017 Tall Ships Regatta! Doors open at 5:00pm, followed by open decks on board the Bluenose II at 6:00pm and a screening of Bluenose: The Legend Live at the Fisheries Museum of the Atlantic at 7:00pm. Enter our draw for a chance to sail on Bluenose II June 10th or 11th!

More Info

Time: June 7. 5:00pm
Place: Company Store, Fisheries Museum

Lunenburg Academy of Music Performance

Concert

Enjoy the latest in Walter Delahunt’s series of the complete Beethoven Piano Sonatas. Hear them masterfully performed.

More Info

Time: June 7. 7:00pm
Place: Lunenburg Academy, 97 Kaulbach Street

Lunenburg Farmers Market

Farmers Market

Our vendors come from all over and produce a wide range of fabulous products – fresh seasonal produce, grass-fed meats, free-range eggs, fresh and smoked fish, plants, fresh flowers, cheese, French breads, wine, preserves, honey, maple syrup, beautiful artisan items and more.

More Info

Time: June 8. 8:30am-12:00pm
Place: Lunenburg Arena

Town of Lunenburg and Rhumb Line Bike Shop

Family Bike Ride

Meet at the trailhead at the base of Dufferin Street. Helmets are required.

More Info

Time: June 8. 6:30pm
Place: Back Harbour Trail

Town of Lunenburg and Rhumb Line Bike Shop

Cycling 101 Repair Clinic/Women on Wheels Ride

We will meet at the Community Centre at 9:00am for an introduction to bike repair and maintenance followed by a 10:00am ride on the Bay to Bay Trail to launch the Women on Wheels program.

More Info

Time: June 9. 9:00am
Place: Community Centre/Bay to Bay Trail

Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation

Rum and Chowder Social

Sample some of our local chef’s best chowders and wash it down with a variety of rum choices. Tickets are $45.00 in advance or $50.00 at the door. For tickets contact BCAF at 634-9977.

More Info

Time: June 9. 6:00pm-9:00pm
Place: Lunenburg School of the Arts

Fisheries Museum of the Atlantic

Open House

Free admission for everyone with lots of new exhibits on display both inside the museum and on the wharf. Activities include Spinners on the Wharf, Boat Modelers guild presentation, Museum Trivia, Music, Face Painting

More Info

Time: June 10. 9:30am-5:00pm
Place: Museum and Wharf – 68 Bluenose Drive

Bluenose II

Public Cruises

For reservations call 1-855-640-3177, email or book online. Decks will be open for the public between tours.

More Info

Time: June 10, 11. 9:30am and 1:30pm
Place: Waterfront

Bluenose Coastal Action Foundation

Multi-Activities

Celebrating Canada’s 150th Anniversary and World Oceans Week with the Lunenburg Heritage & Marine Stewardship Canada 150 Project. Events include Ocean Arts & Crafts for All Ages; Tour a Traditional Wooden Schooner: the Blue Dream Schooner; and Dory Rides with the Canadian Dory Rowing Association.

More Info

Time: June 10. 10:00am-4:00pm
Place: Waterfront

Lunenburg Heritage Society

Heritage House Tour

Enjoy the remarkable interiors of five houses, five churches, one museum, and two educational institutions. During which there will be Tea and Light Refreshments at St. John’s Parish Hall from 2pm - 4pm. Admission is included in House Tour ticket but will open to all for $5.  Tickets: $20 advance/$25 at the door and available at Shop on the Corner or online.

More Info

Time: June 10. 10:00am-4:00pm
Place: Begins at Lunenburg Academy

Lunenburg Churches

Open House

The following churches will open their doors to the public: St. Norbert’s Roman Catholic Church; Central United Church; St. John’s Anglican Church; Zion Evangelical Lutheran Church; St. Andrew’s Presbyterian Church

Time: June 10. 12:00pm-4:00pm
Place: Lunenburg

Ironworks Distillery

Tours and Tastings/Workshops

We welcome you to try free tours and tastings at 1:00pm and 3:00pm. Spaces are limited so call the distillery to book your free tour. They will also be hosting two of the Gin Distillation workshops that run during Spirited Away; once at 1:00pm and once at 4:00pm. Each will run about 1.5 hours and costs $50.00 per person.

More Info

Time: June 10. 11:00am-7:00pm
Place: 2 Kempt Street
